datasource: Heine, Bernd. 1982. Boni Dialects. The Non-Bantu Languages of Kenya. Language and Dialect Atlas of Kenya, vol. 10. Berlin: Dietrich Reimer Verlag. [H82]
geodemoTXT: Jara is a variety of Central Boni spoken for the most part by residents of the town of Mangai in North-eastern Kenya. It was the object of a dialect study by Bernd Heine published in 1982.

termclusters.label: boj-Verb:morph-NegationAffix:
termclusters.note: H82s2.15.3 :: These affixes involve both a prefix and a suffix.

termclusters.label: boj-Verb:morph-SubjSuffMarkers:
termclusters.note: H82s2.15.62 :: The suffix conjugation sub-classes are:I basic,II medial,III causative,IV nasal.
